prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. The euler angles should be set to 0 degrees for the X and Y axes, and -90 degrees for the Z axis. The translation vector should be set to 0 in the X direction, 0.0938 in the Y direction, and 0 in the Z direction. Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. This sketch should consist of 4 lines. * The first line should start at (0,0) and end at (0.0938, 0). * The second line should start at (0.0938,0) and end at (0.0938, 0.75). * The third line should start at (0.0938, 0.75) and end at (0, 0.75). * The fourth line should start at (0, 0.75) and end at (0, 0). Now, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to generate the 3D model. The extrusion depth towards the normal should be 0.0281, while the extrusion depth opposite the normal should be 0. Part 2: Long Thin Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. The euler angles should be set to 90 degrees for the X axis, 0 degrees for the Y axis, and -90 degrees for the Z axis. The translation vector should be set to 0 in the X direction, 0.0656 in the Y direction, and 0 in the Z direction. Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. This sketch should consist of 4 lines. * The first line should start at (0,0) and end at (0.0656, 0). * The second line should start at (0.0656,0) and end at (0.0656, 0.75). * The third line should start at (0.0656, 0.75) and end at (0, 0.75). * The fourth line should start at (0, 0.75) and end at (0, 0). Now, scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to generate the 3D model, with an extrusion depth of 0.0281 towards the normal and 0 opposite the normal. Final Shape: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom, and a Curved Side Combine Parts 1 and 2 into a single assembly. The longitudinal faces of each part should be aligned and joined to form a single rectangular prism with a curved side. This can be achieved using a join or add material Boolean operation. The final shape should be centered in the image. The length of the final shape is the sum of the lengths of Parts 1 and 2, or 0.1194. The width and height are given as 0.0281 and 0.75, respectively.</description>
